title: Converting PDF to Word: The Best Options for PC & Mac

steps.title: Go to https://www.adobe.com/acrobat/online/pdf-to-word.html in your web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.adobe.com/acrobat/online/pdf-to-word.html in your web browser. Adobe, the creator of the PDF document format, now offers a free PDF to Word conversion tool that's easy to use in any web browser. While you may lose some special formatting from the original PDF, you'll be able to edit the converted text in any version of Word. This is the fastest way to convert PDF to Word, and the most convenient if you don't have Word or Adobe Acrobat . While you can convert your first PDF to a Word document without signing in, you may be prompted to log in with an Adobe , Facebook , or Apple account to convert more documents.

steps.title: Drag your PDF to the box.
steps.content: Drag your PDF to the box. This instantly begins uploading the PDF and converting it to the Word DOCX format. [1] X Research source Alternatively, you can click Select a file , choose your PDF, and then click OK or Open to start the upload.

steps.title: Click the blue Download button.
steps.content: Click the blue Download button. This downloads the converted file in the Word DOCX format. [2] X Research source You may have to click Save or OK to start the download.

steps.title: Right-click or Ctrl + click the PDF you want to open.
steps.content: Right-click or Ctrl + click the PDF you want to open. This will open a context menu. As long as you have Word 2013 or later on your PC or Mac, you can open PDFs in Word to convert them to the DOCX format. You may lose some special formatting (like tables, images, and columns) from the PDF, but you'll be able to edit the text in Word as needed.

steps.title: Select Open with.
steps.content: Select Open with . Another menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Word or Microsoft Word on the menu.
steps.content: Click Word or Microsoft Word on the menu. If you don't see this option on Windows, select Choose another app , select Word , and then click Just once . This opens Word and attempts to display the PDF. If you're having trouble doing this on Windows, here's another way to open the PDF in Word: Open Word. Or, if Word is already open, click the File menu and select Open . Click Browse at the bottom. Click the drop-down menu at the bottom-right (the one that says "All Word documents" and select All files . Select your PDF file and click Open .

steps.title: Click OK to convert the file.
steps.content: Click OK to convert the file. When the PDF tries to open, you'll see a pop-up that says, "Word will now convert your PDF to an editable Word document." Once you click OK, the PDF will convert to a Word file and display in Word. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you're converting a larger file, it can take a few minutes to complete.

steps.title: Edit the Word document.
steps.content: Edit the Word document. The converted document may not have perfect page-to-page correspondence due to line and page breaks, graphics, and other details. Making manual edits may be necessary. If you downloaded the PDF from the internet, you'll see a bar at the top of the document asking if you want to enable editing. Click Enable Editing so you can make changes to the converted document.

steps.title: Save the converted PDF.
steps.content: Save the converted PDF. Once you're ready to save the converted PDF as a Word document, do the following: [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Windows — Click File , click Save As , click This PC , enter a file name, select a save location on the left side of the window, and click Save . Mac — Click File , click Save As , enter a name, select a file location, and click Save .

steps.title: Open the PDF you want to convert in Acrobat.
steps.content: Open the PDF you want to convert in Acrobat. If you use the paid version of Adobe Acrobat , you can easily convert PDFs to the Word DOCX format. If double-clicking the PDF doesn't open it in Acrobat, you can open it in Acrobat by right-clicking (or control-clicking) the PDF, selecting Open with , and then selecting Adobe Acrobat (or Adobe Acrobat DC ). [5] X Research source This method is the best option if you want to retain as much formatting from the original PDF as possible. It's also helpful if your PDF contains scanned text, as the conversion will read and convert text from images. While Acrobat is not free, you can get a free 30-day trial at https://www.adobe.com/acrobat.html .

steps.title: Click Export PDF.
steps.content: Click Export PDF . This tool is in the right panel. A list of file types will expand. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Microsoft Word as the export format.
steps.content: Click Microsoft Word as the export format. Additional options will expand. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Word Document.
steps.content: Click Word Document . It's the first option on the right panel. This tells Acrobat what type of document to create. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export . Acrobat will now convert the file and prompt you to name it. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Name the file and click Save.
steps.content: Name the file and click Save . Now that you've saved the PDF as a Word document, you can open and edit it in Microsoft Word. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://drive.google.com in your computer's web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://drive.google.com in your computer's web browser. This will open your Google Drive if you're logged in to your Google account. If you aren't logged in, enter your email address and password when prompted. While you can use Google Drive to upload a PDF, open it in Google Docs , and convert it to Word, special formatting like tables, columns, and images will not appear correctly (or not at all). So, this method works best if you just want to edit the text and not work with the current format.

steps.title: Click the + New button.
steps.content: Click the + New button. It'll be at the top-left corner of your Google Drive.

steps.title: Select File upload.
steps.content: Select File upload . It's the second option on the menu. This opens your computer's file browser.

steps.title: Select the PDF and click Open.
steps.content: Select the PDF and click Open . Your PDF will now upload to your Google Drive. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Double-click the name of the PDF you've uploaded.
steps.content: Double-click the name of the PDF you've uploaded. You'll see it under "1 upload complete" at the bottom-right corner of Google Drive and in your main Google Drive folder. This opens a preview of your PDF.

steps.title: Click the Open with menu.
steps.content: Click the Open with menu. It's at the top-center part of the window. [12] X Research source If you don't see the Open with drop-down box, move your mouse to the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Google Docs on the menu.
steps.content: Click Google Docs on the menu. This opens the PDF in Google Docs. If you don't see Google Docs as an option in the drop-down menu, you can add it: click Connect more apps in the drop-down menu, search for google docs , and Install to get it.

steps.title: Download the PDF as a Word document.
steps.content: Download the PDF as a Word document. Now that you've opened the document in Docs, you can save it as a Microsoft Word file and download it to your computer. Here's how: [13] X Research source Click the File menu at the top-left corner of Google Docs and select Download . Click Microsoft Word (.docx) as the format. Select a save location and/or click Save if prompted.
